p: On the other hand, the sandy plains had the highest values of sand (89.25%), but the lowest of silt (1.25%), EC (0.09 dS/m), OM (0.17%), and sulphate (0.11 meq/L). The soils of both mountain ranges and wadi channels had the lowest contents of nitrogen (18.9 mg/kg), while soils of mountain ranges, wadi channels, and roadsides were the lowest in available phosphorus.
